fields.description:
Web services (Eucalyptus/EC2 at least) will fail to handle requests that exceed the maximum chunk size.

We should have some request size limit, but requests exceeding the limit should fail with a 413 error (entity too large) rather than a 404 or a reset connection.
fields.summary: Web services fail to handle requests larger than the max chunk size

comments.body: Would be good to know what user operations will be affected
[~sjones] Are you suggesting we throw a  413 error when "bootstrap.webservices.http_max_chunk_bytes" is exceeded?  If so where?
[~mmunn1], no, limiting the overall request sized based on the chunk size is a bug that needs to be fixed.

[~sjones] Sorry top keep bothering you on this one but I am still unclear on what exactly is needed for this issue:
1) How exactly would I reproduce this issue?
2) Where in the code does this need to be addressed?

[~mmunn1], pipelines for all services need to handle chunked data (e.g. Handlers#newHttpChunkAggregator), we then need to determine appropriate (but configurable) request size limits for all services and enforce them (failing with a reasonable HTTP error). A single request size limit may be appropriate for all user facing services, with a separate limit for internal services. Object storage already handles chunked data and would not need to change for this issue. Internal pipelines should be updated if needed. Administrative services could be left out of the fix (if impacted), I'm not aware of any use case for large (request) data with admin services.

[~sjones] As far as I can tell these are the effected pipelines:
1) InternalClientPipeline
2) IdentityClientPipeline
3) ClusterClientPipelineFactory
4) GatherLogClientPipeline

Do you have any suggested names and values for the these?
[~mmunn1], the client pipelines should not need updating. We need to add support for chunk aggregation to the service pipelines such as QueryPipeline, SoapPipeline and InternalPipeline.

[~sjones] The only service pipelines that I see the need  Handlers#newHttpChunkAggregator are QueryPipeline and SoapPipeline. InternalPipeline is an abstract class extending FilteredPipeline( ) and with and abstract  addHandlers( ChannelPipeline pipeline ) method;  Are there other service pipelines I am missing?
[~mmunn1], I think fixing the QueryPipeline would cover most use cases for large requests.
[~sjones] Any Suggestions for the default size? I will make new configurable property INTERNAL_HTTP_CHUNK_BUFFER_MAX.

[~mmunn1], the max chunk size is probably a reasonable default. On upgrade we may need to check if the chunk size has been modified and set the new property accordingly. I suggest something like PIPELINE_MAX_REQUEST_SIZE for the property name, though depending on what it applies to perhaps it needs some qualification? (  PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE?, PIPELINE_DEFAULT_MAX_REQUEST_SIZE? )
[~sjones] Do you mean if the CLIENT_HTTP_CHUNK_BUFFER_MAX has been modified set the new PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE to match it?

[~mmunn1], I mean the default could be the same as the HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES and we should ensure the new property (e.g. PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE)  is not smaller than this value when upgrading, so we do not break deployments where the value is customized.
[~sjones] Where in the code should we do the On Upgrade check to make sure PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE is not smaller than HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES?
[~mmunn1], you could add the check to StaticPropertyEntryUpgrade42.

Code Review Request : EUCA-5918 Web services fail to handle requests larger than the max chunk size

branch : dev-mmunn1-EUCA-5918

diff :  git show --color b1cc889d7a77131f8b01d755cf10c03b9549391b

Summary: Web services fail to handle requests larger than the max chunk size

Solution: Add a new configurable property and handler PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE and set default to at least the same size as as HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES on upgrade.

Regression test: http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/817/

Unit test : Modify property HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES to a larger value than the default and make sure PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE matches that after upgrade

[~mmunn1], the QueryPipeline accesses the body of the message to check the parameters so it seems problematic to put the aggregation stage later in the pipeline, but perhaps this is not an issue in practice. 

The new property should be updated to have a description that does not mention chunks and to have a default value so it can be reset. We should also validate the value as using values <= 0 will cause the pipelines to fail with an IllegalArgumentException. I think the request size limit is related to the chunk size, we should be clear if we expect the overall size limit to do anything if less that the chunk size (i.e. we should document how these properties are related)

When moving to QA please detail the expected error for a request that is too large.

[~sjones] 
1) Would you like for me to change the placement using pipeline.addfirst or leave it as is?
2) Can you suggest a good way to test the size limit ?
3) do we want to change the error to a 413 from a 404?

[~mmunn1], the QueryPipeline#checkAccepts method will have run before QueryPipeline#addHandlers so where you add the aggregation stage will not have any impact. 

To test the size limit I would use a large cloudformation template, you would also have to modify the cloudformation.request_template_body_max_length_bytes property to allow a larger template to be passed in a request.

A large request (that would otherwise be accepted) should not be rejected with a 404 error, a 413 or 400 with a descriptive error message seem reasonable to me.
[~sjones] I am unclear on where exactly to add the new handler as you are correct it has no effect as it is? Any pointer on this would be greatly appreciated.

[~mmunn1],  the best option is to move the parsing of the request out of QueryPipeline#checkAccepts and into a separate handler. We could move the required parameter check but I think requiring a Version parameter is not the correct behaviour and could simply be removed (if removing we'd have to verify that we were not currently expecting the version later in the pipeline). This would mean there would be two new handlers, one performing aggregation and then another processing the parameters.

[~sjones] Removing the checks for the requiredQueryParams from QueryPipeline#checkAccepts does in fact let the new newQueryHttpChunkAggregator() regulate the size of the request body.   Do we want to leave the rest of the query parsing to happen in QueryPipeline#checkAccepts?  I do not see the need for a new handler here?   Let me know if I am missing.something.
[~sjones] Also, should I go ahead and add  a default for bootstrap.webservices.http_max_chunk_bytes so that can be reset as well?
[~sjones] actually it appears the the bootstrap.webservices.http_max_chunk_bytes handler is called again later in the pipeline I will continue to investigate.

[~mmunn1], parsing of a large (chunked) request cannot be performed in QueryPipeline#checkAccepts as when that method is invoked only the first chunk would be available rather than the full request. Parsing of the request must occur after the aggregation stage so that the full request can be parsed. Aggregation and parameter parsing for the request must also occur before other stages that use them, such as HMAC authentication.

[~sjones] The request is also limited in line #140 of NioHttpDecoder.java by StackConfiguration.HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES.  I am not sure how we want to handle this? Do we want to just make StackConfiguration.HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES configurable instead of creating a new configurable property?
[~mmunn1], that is the maximum chunk size and is already configurable, it does not limit the size of the overall request.

[~sjones] But if I increase the new property  StackConfiguration.PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE to be larger than  StackConfiguration.HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES the request is still limited by the HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES?

[~mmunn1], what we want to happen is that the individual chunks are aggregated in the new handler which also checks the overall request size. It is expected that the initial chunk will be constrained to the maximum chunk size, which is why we do not want to process the request body until after the aggregation handler. I'm not clear what "the request is still limited" means exactly else I'd give a more specific response.

[~sjones] I have added your suggested changes and it is working correctly. I have made both the  StackConfiguration.HTTP_MAX_CHUNK_BYTES and  the new StackConfiguration.PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE resettable. The new diff is  dev-mmunn1-EUCA-5918 b6d1c17e66878ada831f1ce5d707387726d565dc

The large cloudformation template now fails if it is larger than PIPELINE_MAX_QUERY_REQUEST_SIZE with the error "euform-create-stack: error (400 Bad Request): HTTP content length exceeded 102400 bytes."

[~mmunn1], looks good generally. The QueryPipeline should be updated to reject SOAP messages so they are correctly sent to the SOAP pipeline and we should not accept request messages with types other than MappingHttpRequests (i.e. checkAccepts must return false if the message is not of that type).

To Reproduce:
We need to send a request that is larger than the default value for bootstrap.webservices.pipeline_max_query_request_size which is 102400 bytes.
I have attached a cloud-formation template "large.json that is 129KB for testing.
{code}
1) set the cloudformation.request_template_body_max_length_bytes to handle the larger template. 
    euca-modify-property -p cloudformation.request_template_body_max_length_bytes=150000
2) run the test template large.json (attached) 
   euform-create-stack --template-file large.json testStack
   You should see the error "euform-create-stack: error (400 Bad Request): HTTP content length exceeded 102400 bytes."
3) Now increase the new property bootstrap.webservices.pipeline_max_query_request_size to handle the larger template
    euca-modify-property -p bootstrap.webservices.pipeline_max_query_request_size=150000
4) Try and create the stack again:
     euform-create-stack --template-file large.json testsStack
    the stack should create successfully now.
{code}

[~sjones] added the checks for SOAP messages and MappingHttpRequests  

dev-mmunn-EUCA-5918 06bf03f3cd4e286f4d2772b21ffbc90096c1cba1
[~mmunn1], thanks, looks good to me.
Verified that after increasing 'bootstrap.webservices.pipeline_max_query_request_size', the large requests are accepted.
Released in 4.2
